name: NEXT IceStorm 1.5.6
description:
Latest Version of the Deck, back to needing 4 Agendas to win.

Going to local tournament this weekend, will post results after the tourney.

name: Weyland - It smells like Meat V3
Derez & Destroy 1.0
description:
This is my first attempt at a deck to derez and trash as much ice as possible, making runs cheap and multi access easy.

Obviously the deck revolves around the combo of Darwin with e3 to easily break through ice, even big stuff. The advantage I see here is that I can have Darwin up quickly thanks to Djinn. I can then give it a good kickstart with Grimoire and Surge which I think are good cards to have since I already have a lot of virus cards in the deck.

Crescentus, Shutdown and recurring parasites are my ways of dealing with big expensive ice infront of HQ or R&D. I can put a lot of pressure on centrals with Medium and Nerve agent or go for targets of opportunity in remotes. Wyrm serves the role of being a Backup in case the corp purges to not be completely locked out.

There are two things I would like to hear about and those are tutoring and econ. What can I add to get my mimic quickly if I think I'll be up vs a swordsman and what to cut for it? Replace Shutdown with Special order? Do I have enough econ, even if tagged? I kinda want to avoid tags as much as possible but if I get hit with a midseason, there is not much I can do. Maybe cut 1 Medium and 1 Nerve (since I can tutor them via Djinn and recur with Deja Vu) for 2x Liberated accounts?

name: Reina Meltdown v0.4
description: 4th version already. Things are starting to get better...PC helps this deck a lot. Econ got a lot better and most things are cheap enough to build it fast. Imp to crush fast advance is awesome. This is a slow deck and no Medium or Nerve Agent hurts. I'm still refining it so any help would be appreciated.

name: AT&T
description:
"Reach Out And Touch Someone"

The core concept of this deck is to turn the tables and meddle with the runner as much as possible. Uninstall their programs, wreck their grip, tax them in running, drain their accounts.

It's not a tag-storm deck. It's intended to be a tempo-disruption deck in order to create opportunities to score when the runner is trying to bounce back from their game plan.

Something Damon Stone said in an interview at Gen Con. You want in? Come in, I don't mind. I'll even let you in. These four pieces of Ice, don't worry about that, none of them are end the run.

Sweeps Week into an Invasion of Privacy. RSVP into a Data Hound or a Snoop. Close Accounts then rez City Surveillance.

I will say I don't think this archetype is ready for prime time. Tag Punishment, Tag Tax, Tag & Bag are probably better. This is an experiment in mechanics and making the runner decide whether to pay the tax in order to pressure me or not.

I'm considering more Tag Mechanics to get the runner tagged on the Corp turn, but I'm still mulling those ideas.

name: NBN Burn
description: The theory behind this deck is to maximise the power of the new NBN cards Sweeps Week as well as TGTBT. If the runner doesn't expect the Scorch they probably wont put down a Plascrete, which will get him killed eventually. If they do expect the Scorch they will play more conservatively giving you more time to fast advance agendas and win the game through AP. The increase hand size also helps you keep those scorches in hand without feeling that cramped by them.

name: Counter Strike
description: A deck that focuses on PE's strength: punishing the runner any time they take an action against you.

name: The World is Spining*
description: Looking for comments. Performance has been good in testing, but there is always room for improvement. Also, potentially considering Data Raven, but don't really see room for it.

name: FIRST Design - Guarding the Newb 1.0
description:
New to Netrunner and this is my first corp deck. I figured that NEXT Design was a good first deck choice bc it gets down early ice to hinder aggro runner decks and can build up an "ice fortress" against the decks that slowly piece together their credits and ice breakers for a big run.

I have played a few test games and haven't quite figured out whether I should be aiming for a fast advance win or stack up my ice and grind out a win in the long haul. Originally, I had 2x Sunset instead of the Shipment from SanSan, but there wasn't a situation in any of my games where I felt I needed it, so SanSan was subbed in and I have yet to play with it. I also found that I had a lot of ice that cost too much and I was always having to make the tough choice of going broke and rezzing my ice or keeping my money and letting the runner through. I had 2x Viper and another Heimdall 2.0, but removed them for 3x NEXT Bronze which is much cheaper and better for the early game. To keep my money up, I swapped 2x Shipment from MirroMorph out for my 1 copy of Thomas Haas and another Adonis Campaign.

Please feel free to leave comments and suggestions as all constructive criticism is welcomed.

name: Homeless Kasparov v2
description:
This is a combo deck based around 3 cards, Pawn, Scheherazade and Deep Red. Please read about the strategy and combo here: http://netrunomicon.com/b003/

This is a tweaked version of this deck to increase tempo and initial aggression, as I found that MO was both too slow and just not used enough during the game to be worth it. So I replaced it with Armitage to increase speed

I've replaced Kati with Aesops and I need clicks rather than pure money, and Æsop combos great with both Armitage, Daily Casts and even the leftover SMC or first pawn you play on your Scheherazade.

v2: I've removed all Knights and added an Imp and a Sneakdoor instead.

Imp is there in order to somewhat counter combo and Fast Advance decks, as initial Sansans or full HQ with Operations is difficult to crack. The Imp further combos with Æsop, Scavenge and Scheherazade which is also very nice.

Sneakdoor is there to put pressure on Archives because very often the corp will just leave it open and double or triple down on HQ and R&D, making your pawns much much slower. This now forces them to scramble to protect archives, leaving you usually with a single ICE you can put your pawns on. And if not, it at least provides easy access to HQ for your Imp to do its work.

  • This deck in action

name: Counter Strike v2
description: A deck that focuses on PE's strength: punishing the runner any time they take an action against you.

name: Death From Above!
description:
Trying to make good old rich Waylend TnB. I would like to make room for the new punitive counterstrike but I'm not sure how to fit it in. I debated cutting the Sea Sources and using the influence on a third snare to keep up my tagging powers. I hate to cut the transactions since, they synergize well with the identity (maybe take out one restructure). And then I also wonder if the counterstikes would even be worth it when I'm running so many low cost agendas!

Any comments are very much appreciated, I'm looking for input

name: Broke HB
description:
Everyone has tried it and so have I! I'm using the new identity plus Bioroid Efficiency Research and Oversight AI to create first turn super servers. I went with the minimum 25 ICE to justify the use of the identity. I went with higher cost agendas since I should be able to protect them and score them early, and this frees up more room in the deck.

I have Jackson Howard and Green Level to draw into my enablers. JH also synergizes with Accelerated Beta Test by protecting any agendas I may have to toss. As far as the ICE goes I tried to divide it into either SUPER EXPENSIVE/POWERFUL (Heimdall, Wotan, Janus), super cheap ETR stuff (Paper Wall, Enigma) or enablers (Minelayer, Howler). Viktor, Roto and even Tollbooth walk some middle ground there.

Originally I had no economy in this deck what so ever, but I found that to be a little too taxing on my clicks so I added in two Melange which seems like plenty with the amount of drawing I'm doing anyway.

Like I said I'm sure multiple people have tested this idea out and I would love your input on any changes you would recommend!

name: Reina's spinal tap
description: Run cheap and keep the corp poor
